title: How Many Calories in a Gin and Tonic?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in tonic and gin for a standard serving, including carbs from tonic, alcohol impact, and tweaks like diet options.
h1: How Many Calories in a Gin and Tonic?
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) gin at 40% ABV, 4 oz (118 ml) regular tonic water, no garnishes, ice, or additional mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, tonic type (regular vs. diet), and alcohol strength. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard gin and tonic contains about 138 calories, with most from the tonic's sugars and gin's alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic water instead of regular
Add a splash of lime juice (1 oz)
Double the gin pour (3 oz total)

faqs.q: How many calories in tonic and gin with diet tonic?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal, since diet tonic adds zero calories.

faqs.q: Where do calories in a gin and tonic come from?
faqs.a: Primarily from the tonic's sugars (41 kcal) and gin's alcohol (97 kcal); no fat or protein.
Regular version has 10.3 g carbs from tonic; opt for diet tonic for under 1 g carbs.

faqs.q: How does tonic water affect calories in gin drinks?
faqs.a: 4 oz regular tonic adds ~41 kcal and 10 g sugars; it's the main non-alcohol calorie source.

faqs.q: What if I use less tonic in gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Reducing to 2 oz tonic lowers total to ~110 kcal, cutting carbs and sugars proportionally.
